verses.roman:
nānā-roga-grasta,--calite vasite nā pāri
pañca-roga-pīḍā-vyākula, rātri-dine mari

synonyms: nānā-roga-grasta—affected by so many diseases; calite—to walk; vasite—to sit down; nā pāri—I am not properly able; pañca-roga-pīḍā-vyākula—always disturbed by five kinds of disease; rātri-dine—day or night; mari—I can die any time.
translation: I am infected by so many diseases that I can neither properly walk nor properly sit. Indeed, I am always exhausted by five kinds of disease. I may die at any time of the day or night.
